assignments.title: Homework
assignments.description: One homework question per week from the posted exercises. Each assignment will be worth 20 points, no late submissions are accepted.

assignments.title: Class Discussions and Case Studies
assignments.description: One reading per week is required along with the homework problems. The readings will be posted to Canvas and should be downloaded and reviewed prior to the week they will be discussed.

assignments.title: Team Project
assignments.description: Choose one of the Major Defense Systems (e.g., Abrams, Bradley, B52, F16, etc.). Write a critical review focusing on the supportability and logistics associated with your chosen topic.

policies.late_work: No late submissions are accepted for homework.
policies.academic_integrity: The Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity is binding for this course.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom, recording a slide presentation with audio narration, recording, editing, and uploading video via Panopto.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This course introduces students to a disciplined approach to providing efficient and effective system logistics support.
learning_outcomes: Integrate the knowledge acquired in this course.
Integrate how the concepts and ideas in this course apply to actual business and/or government organizations.
Apply the system supportability and logistics tools and techniques acquired in this course.
Apply and improve the studentsâ€™ ability to effectively work on teams.
